channel.title: New ram
channel.description:
K so I got this other computer which has 1GB RAM and I want to upgrade it to 2GB
I need 240-Pin DDR2 SDRAM DDR2 667 (PC2 5300) RAM.
Anything I should know before replacing RAM?
Oh, and I was looking at this. [url=http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16820134046]http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16820134046[/url]

item.title: New ram
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I’d buy another 2gb stick and put it in beside the 1gb stick (or do you have 2x512?)

His MoBo only supports 2GB max, so I just told him to buy 2x1GB

Read full topic

item.title: New ram
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:7, topic:234566”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=309272.msg2471180#msg2471180 date=1222995307]
Buy a 2gb stick. When I tried 2x1gb(exactly same brand/model) in my dual channel mobo, it just fucked up.
[/quote]You’re a fucking retard then. That’s exactly what you’re supposed to do. [/quote]

It had problems shoving the BIOS into the rams. Every reboot, I needed to reset the bios. Got annoying after a while, so I set back to 1gb.

It also depleted the BIOS/CMOS battery.

Read full topic

item.title: New ram
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:2, topic:234566”]Buy a 2gb stick. When I tried 2x1gb(exactly same brand/model) in my dual channel mobo, it just fucked up.[/quote]You’re a fucking retard then. That’s exactly what you’re supposed to do.

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:5, topic:234566”]I’d buy another 2gb stick and put it in beside the 1gb stick (or do you have 2x512?)[/quote]Again, it’s generally better to have the same brand/size/speed/etc. as the original stick(s).

Read full topic

item.title: New ram
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

Why 667mhz? Most motherboards that run DDR2 should be able to run them at 800mhz (PC-6400) and 800mhz ram is very common and cheap.

Post your motherboard on here, and if it can you could throw away you current 1gb stick, get some new 800mhz ram 2gigs and (2x1gb) and run them in dual channel, should blow you away.

Read full topic

item.description:

I’d buy another 2gb stick and put it in beside the 1gb stick (or do you have 2x512?)

item.description:

Only if you set it up right… My computer is still boosting it with 1gb of ram. It plays crysis and COD4.
